They’ve been… distant. I don’t really talk to my family much anymore. It’s not like anything dramatic happened—we just sort of drifted, and I stopped having the energy to keep reaching out when it felt so one-sided. And my one close friend… she’s still around, but I haven’t messaged her in a while. I keep thinking about it, but then I convince myself I’ll just bring her down, or she’s probably too busy for me anyway.
I see people online posting about their lives, about brunch or birthdays or even just random outings, and I can’t help but feel like I’m on the outside looking in. Like I’m watching life happen to other people while I’m just… stuck. Sometimes I wonder if they’d even notice if I disappeared.
I know that sounds dramatic, but it’s just this constant ache of not belonging anywhere. I miss feeling close to someone. I miss feeling like I mattered to someone. But now, I just assume people would rather not deal with whatever this is I’ve become.

Yeah… I have. Even the smallest decisions feel like they take so much effort now. Things that used to be automatic—like what to eat, when to take a shower, whether to reply to a message—can turn into these endless loops in my head. I’ll just sit there, staring at nothing, thinking, “Does it even matter?” And usually I end up doing nothing at all.
It’s like my brain’s stuck in molasses. The more I try to push through, the heavier it feels. I used to be really organized, the kind of person who made lists and stuck to them. But now, even writing a list feels pointless. Most of the time I just wait until something absolutely has to be done… and even then, I drag myself through it like I’m carrying the weight of the world.
And the worst part is—I know I’m not functioning like I used to. I’m aware of it, and I still can’t seem to change it. Which just feeds into that voice in my head that says I’m failing, that I’m letting my life fall apart and I’m too weak to stop it.
It’s exhausting, being stuck in this cycle.

So no, I guess I haven’t found anything that really helps. Not in a way that sticks. I keep hoping maybe something will eventually click, but that hope feels thinner and thinner lately.

Sleep… it’s strange. I do sleep—sometimes too much, sometimes not enough—but either way, it never feels like it actually helps. I wake up already tired, like my body went through something in the night that I don’t even remember. There are nights I lie awake for hours with my mind racing over everything I’m not doing, or everything I’ve messed up. And then there are nights where I just crash, but it’s not restful. There are mornings I open my eyes and my first thought is, Oh. This again. Not even in a dramatic way—just... flat. Like I already know how the day’s going to go before it even starts.
And when I don’t sleep well, everything else feels even harder—like my brain gets foggy, and the world moves too fast around me. I used to love early mornings. I used to feel something when the day was new. Now it just feels like something I have to survive. Again.

Yeah… lately I’ve been thinking a lot about how empty my days feel. Not just in terms of energy, but meaning. I go through the motions—wake up, maybe eat something, scroll through my phone, stare at the TV—but none of it feels like it matters. There’s no purpose behind it, just… passing time. Killing time, really. And that thought creeps in more and more: Is this it? Is this just how life is going to be now?
I used to have things I looked forward to. Even little things, like volunteering at the community center or planning a weekend with a friend. Now, everything just feels too far away or too hard. I see other people building their lives, moving forward, and I’m stuck in place—watching, but not really part of anything.
It’s been hard to shake the feeling that I’m fading. Not in a dramatic, obvious way—just slowly becoming someone I don’t recognize. Someone I wouldn’t have imagined being. And that thought lingers all the time now: What happened to me?
So yeah… I guess that’s been on my mind a lot. Not because I’m looking for a fix or anything. I just… needed to say it out loud.

Yeah… I’ve been feeling that way about myself for a long time now. It’s like I look in the mirror and don’t really see myself anymore. Just this tired, faded version of who I used to be. Someone who doesn’t smile much, who avoids her own reflection more often than not. I used to have a sense of who I was—even if I wasn’t always happy, I at least felt real. Now it’s like I’m just… occupying space.
I question my worth constantly. I don’t feel useful, or wanted, or needed. And when I do think of something I should do—like reach out, or clean up, or even just try to care—it’s like there’s this voice in my head saying, What for? No one would notice anyway.
There are times I remember little pieces of who I used to be—someone with plans, with friends, with reasons to get up in the morning—and it feels so far away it’s almost like I’m remembering someone else’s life. Like I was just borrowing it for a while.
And the thing is, I don’t even know where the shift happened. There wasn’t one big moment… just this slow unraveling. And now I don’t know how to gather all those pieces of myself again, or if they’re even still there.
